New Records: Anthony Edwards scored 29 points and shot 7-for-14 from 3-point range.
Nikola Jokic recorded a triple-double with 26 points, 13 assists, and 9 rebounds.
Jamal Murray was placed in the concussion protocol after colliding with Karl-Anthony Towns.
Key Match Events: The Timberwolves trailed by 10 points in the fourth quarter before closing the game on a 17-4 run to secure the victory.
Edwards scored the go-ahead basket with a floating jump shot to put Minnesota on top 117-116 with 25.7 seconds to go.
Gobert added a pair of free throws to increase the lead to three.
A highlight-reel play by Braun, who leaped for a dunk over Gobert, led to a technical foul after the play was reviewed.
Denver played down the stretch without guard Jamal Murray, who left in the third quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: The Timberwolves opened a 16-point lead in the second quarter.
The Nuggets answered with an 18-2 run to even the score at 51-all with 4:09 left in the half.
Post-Match Reflections: Timberwolves coach Chris Finch praised the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Jamal Murray's absence was a significant factor in the Nuggets' performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a high-stakes matchup with both teams vying for a win in the early season.
The Nuggets had a 25-3 run to grab a 112-102 lead with 4:17 remaining.
